definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: The beach life-guards usually flag one another for communication.
sentences.chinese: 海濱救生員通常用旗號傳達信息。

sentences.english: Now the lifeguards have all gone home.
sentences.chinese: 現在救生員全都回家了。

sentences.english: The lifeguard helps Dan out of the water.
sentences.chinese: 救生員幫助丹恩回到岸上。

sentences.english: If there are lifeguards, let them know your plans before you start swimming.
sentences.chinese: 如果有救生員，游泳之前告訴他們你的計劃。

sentences.english: If you can't get back to the beach, tread water and wave for a lifeguard's help.
sentences.chinese: 假如你無法游回岸邊，可踩水並向救生員揮手求救。

sentences.english: The lifeguard held the drowning man's head above water.
sentences.chinese: 救生員把溺水者的頭托出水面。

sentences.english: Mark won again, splashing the lifeguards even more.
sentences.chinese: 馬克又贏了，那些救生員也被濺得更溼了。

sentences.english: The lifeguards held a sit-in protest at Repulse Bay in the afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 參加行動的救生員在淺水灣泳灘靜坐。

sentences.english: The lifeguard saved the drowning girl at the risk of (losing) his life.
sentences.chinese: 這個救生員冒著生命的危險救起溺水的女孩。

sentences.english: By lending a helping hand to the lifeguards , Scott saved two children from drowning.
sentences.chinese: 斯科特協助救生員救起了兩個落水的兒童。

sentences.english: Today, while lifeguarding, I saw someone in the wave-pool who appeared to be drowning.
sentences.chinese: 今天我做救生員，看到有人好像溺水了，就過去救他。

sentences.english: Lifeguards have to undertake extensive1 classroom and hands-on training.
sentences.chinese: 救生員必須通過密集的課堂及實務訓練。

sentences.english: The sun bronzed the lifeguards's skin.
sentences.chinese: 太陽曬黑了救生員的皮膚。
譚雅是位美麗的救生員。

definition: a fish that escaped the net (idiom)/(fig.) sb or sth that slips through the net
